text:
Bundesliga
Bayern: Schweinsteiger talks about his preference for coaching
Former Bayern Munich player Bastian Schweinsteiger has shown his preference for the coaching post, which has been vacant since Nico Kovac's departure last Sunday.
06 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Mourad Bennis



Niko KovacOn post since 2018, Niko Kovac has resigned to its leaders after the heavy disappointment against Frankfurt. Discover the names of his possible successors.Icon Sport



Laurent BlancLibreIcon Sport



Massimiliano Allegri LibreIcon Sport



Ralf RangnickLibreIcon Sport



Jupp HeynckesLibreIcon Sport



Mark Van BommelServing at PSV EindhovenIcon Sport



Ars√®ne WengerLibreIcon Sport



Jos√© MourinhoLibreIcon Sport



Willy SagnolLibreIcon Sport



Julian NagelsmannOffice at LeipzigIcon Sport



Domenico TedescoSitting at Spartak MoscowIcon Sport

Bayern Munich: the tracks to replace Niko Kovac




Bastian Schweinsteiger spoke about the succession of Nico Kovac. And for him, no doubt, the technician Jos√© Mourinho has the qualifications to take over the reins of the Bavarian club.

Mourinho acclaimed by Schweinsteiger




Bastian Schweinsteiger + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Just retired, Bastian Schweinsteiger spoke to the German newspaper Bild about the future coach of Bayern Munich. The former glory of the Bavarian club seems to tip for the solution Jose Mourinho.
He said: "I can imagine Mourinho in Germany, I remember that he always asked me questions about Bayern and the Bundesliga, and during our away games there was always the Bundesliga on television. He really knew all the players, even the least known, he was also learning German, he did not work in the Bundesliga, so I guess he would be tempted by an experience there. "
